docs.text: Welcome to test doc site Welcome page This is a test docpage , here I am trying to create a documentation website. API access should have all the details about using the API of an imaginary web service. Technical info: The website is written in markdown, all the source files are in a separate repository . It's all built together using MKDocs mkdocs.org and hosted w/ Github Pages.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: This is a test docpage , here I am trying to create a documentation website. API access should have all the details about using the API of an imaginary web service.
docs.title: Welcome page

docs.text: The website is written in markdown, all the source files are in a separate repository . It's all built together using MKDocs mkdocs.org and hosted w/ Github Pages.
docs.title: Technical info:

docs.text: This method allows you to get a user's note Request syntax Every user has note id's starts from 00001. To access particular note you have to put doth user's and note's ids in query parameters. https://api.mywebsite.com/userinfo?uid=<user_id>&nid=<note_id> query parameters: uid -- User ID. nid -- Note number. Response syntax Parameter Info Type nid user id integer title note's title string text note's body string created date and time of creation string, iso 8601 modified date and time of last change string, iso 8601 Request example https://api.mywebsite.com/userinfo?uid=124334426&nid=00012 Response example note: { nid:00012, title:'my note', created: '2018-05-15T20:05:08+00:00' modified: '2018-05-15T22:05:08+00:00' text: 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.' }
docs.title: Api getnote

docs.text: Every user has note id's starts from 00001. To access particular note you have to put doth user's and note's ids in query parameters. https://api.mywebsite.com/userinfo?uid=<user_id>&nid=<note_id> query parameters: uid -- User ID. nid -- Note number.
docs.title: Request syntax

docs.text: Parameter Info Type nid user id integer title note's title string text note's body string created date and time of creation string, iso 8601 modified date and time of last change string, iso 8601
docs.title: Response syntax

docs.text: https://api.mywebsite.com/userinfo?uid=124334426&nid=00012
docs.title: Request example

docs.text: note: { nid:00012, title:'my note', created: '2018-05-15T20:05:08+00:00' modified: '2018-05-15T22:05:08+00:00' text: 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.' }
docs.title: Response example

docs.text: This method allows you to get all info about user's account Request syntax https://api.mywebsite.com/userinfo?uid=<user_id> query parameters: uid -- User Id Response syntax Parameter Info Type uid user id integer age user's age integer text user's description string Request example https://api.mywebsite.com/userinfo?uid=124334426 Response example user: { uid:124334426, age:21, text: 'test text' }
docs.title: API endpoints

docs.text: https://api.mywebsite.com/userinfo?uid=<user_id> query parameters: uid -- User Id
docs.title: Request syntax

docs.text: Parameter Info Type uid user id integer age user's age integer text user's description string
docs.title: Response syntax

docs.text: https://api.mywebsite.com/userinfo?uid=124334426
docs.title: Request example

docs.text: user: { uid:124334426, age:21, text: 'test text' }

docs.text: Trying to create tabs in markdown Http GET / HTTP/1.1 User-Agent: MyClient/1.0.0 Accept: application/vnd.travis-ci.2+json Host: api.travis-ci.org HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json {"hello":"world"} Shell $ travis raw / {"hello":"world"} Ruby require 'travis' # You usually don't want to fire API requests manually client = Travis::Client.new client.get_raw('/') # => {"hello"=>"world"} client.get('/repos/sinatra/sinatra') # => {"repo"=>#<Travis::Client::Repository: sinatra/sinatra>}
docs.title: Trying to create tabs in markdown

docs.text: Http GET / HTTP/1.1 User-Agent: MyClient/1.0.0 Accept: application/vnd.travis-ci.2+json Host: api.travis-ci.org HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json {"hello":"world"} Shell $ travis raw / {"hello":"world"} Ruby require 'travis' # You usually don't want to fire API requests manually client = Travis::Client.new client.get_raw('/') # => {"hello"=>"world"} client.get('/repos/sinatra/sinatra') # => {"repo"=>#<Travis::Client::Repository: sinatra/sinatra>}
